intro: Gibbaeum heathii, commonly known as the Cape buffalo grass, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its dense, low-growing rosettes of fleshy, blue-green leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers during the summer months, which are followed by pale pink to white fruits. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy species that thrives in well-drained soils. Gibbaeum heathii is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
